WorkItem.Description:
The custom item filters are not working. I tried to create one for "Trophy of the Crusade" and one for "Protector's Mark of Sanctification".
Â 
Neither of them worked no matter how I entered them. I did use different combinations of regex, and non-regex to try to make them work. I verified my regex using http://gskinner.com/RegExr/
WorkItem.Summary: [ItemFilters] Custom item filters are not working

Comments.Message:
This was because I was creating a second filter to negate what was in another preset filter. There already was a value inserted into the Armor Tokens filter (which I had enabled), then I was trying to negate that with my custom filter, and it didn't work.

I'm changing the priority on the bug to lower, in that, when a user creates a custom filter, it should supersede any existing filters to prevent confusion.
There is no determination of a Custom Filter vs the provided Filters, they are just all Filters. You will have to edit them however you need to to make them work.

Ok, riddle me this: 

How can I work the filters to return me a list of items that can be purchased with Emblems of Triumph, but do not also cost Trophy's of the crusade?

I tried creating a filter specifically for Trophy of the Crusade, and disabling it, however, it did not work.

(I've been at this for 3 hours. Either I'm extremely stupid, too close to the problem, or the functionality isn't as straightforward as it needs to be)

If it can't be done, or requires some work on the back end to make it possible, then the defect stands (maybe with a different name and description, but still...)
It doesn't work, that's why it doesn't work. There's already a ticket open for that.
I tried again to create a separate filter for trophy's and it works. There is no functional defect, however, the default filters could stand to be cleaned/updated
